articles.summary: Strange surface patterns found on Uranus' moons surprise astronomers Astronomers expected to see radiation-blasted scars on the sides of Uranus’ biggest moons that trail one after the other in orbit. Instead, they found darker patches on the moon faces that plow forward. The mismatch hints at unseen dust streams and a surprisingly quiet magnetosphere around the tipped-over planet.
